results.title: [A fixed-dose lisinopril+amlodipine+rosuvastatin combination: prospects for its use in patients with hypertension and concomitant dyslipidemia].

results.title: Diverse effects of increasing lisinopril doses on lipid abnormalities in chronic nephropathies.
results.text_hl: METHODS AND RESULTS: In this longitudinal study, we evaluated the extent to which uptitration of the @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ to maximum tolerated doses (median [range]: 30 [10 to 40] mg/d) ameliorated @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Dyslipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050171 @@@dyslipidemia@@@ in 28 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with nondiabetic chronic @DISEASE_Kidney_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D007674 @@@nephropathies@@@.

citations.NLM: Ruggenenti P, Mise N, Pisoni R, Arnoldi F, Pezzotta A, Perna A, Cattaneo D, Remuzzi G. Diverse effects of increasing lisinopril doses on lipid abnormalities in chronic nephropathies. Circulation. 2003 Feb 4;107(4):586-92. PMID: 12566371

results.title: [Safety and Efficacy of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin Therapy in Patients With Metabolic Syndrome and Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease].
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@PATIENTS@@@ AND METHODS: 6 months randomized study of fixed combination of amlodipin and @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ with or without @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ of 20 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with 2 grade of arterial @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Dyslipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050171 @@@dyslipidemia@@@ with @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@ and @DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@nonalcoholic fatty liver disease@@@ (@DISEASE_Non_alcoholic_Fatty_Liver_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D065626 @@@NAFLD@@@).

citations.NLM: Baranova EI, Berezina AV, Melioranskaya EI, Polyakova EA. [Safety and Efficacy of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin Therapy in Patients With Metabolic Syndrome and Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease]. Kardiologiia. 2015 Oct;55(10):68-75. PMID: 28294798

results.title: Effect of losartan and spironolactone on triglyceride-rich lipoproteins in diabetic nephropathy
results.text_hl: We hypothesized that long-term administration of @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ 100 mg or @CHEMICAL_Spironolactone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013148 @@@spironolactone@@@ 25 mg once daily added onto @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ 80 mg once daily improves @<m>DISEASE_Dyslipidemias</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050171 @@@dyslipidemia@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetic_Nephropathies @DISEASE_MESH:D003928 @@@DN@@@.

citations.NLM: Srivastava A, Adams-Huet B, Vega GL, Toto RD. Effect of losartan and spironolactone on triglyceride-rich lipoproteins in diabetic nephropathy J Investig Med. 2016 Aug;64(6):1102-8. PMID: 27388615
